title: FDA’s rotten definition of “healthy” food is finally getting tossed
description: For now, salmon and nuts are not eligible for "healthy" label, but sugary cereals are.

title: NASA and SpaceX are studying a Hubble telescope boost, adding 15 to 20 years of life
description: "It's doing great science as we speak."

title: This underwater camera operates wirelessly without batteries
description: New ultralow-power imaging method employs underwater backscatter imaging.

title: Numerous orgs hacked after installing weaponized open source apps
description: PuTTY, KiTTY, TightVNC, Sumatra PDF Reader, and muPDF/Subliminal Recording all targeted.

title: The rest of Intel Arc’s A700-series GPU prices: A750 lands Oct. 12 below $300
description: A770 comes in two tiers; Intel preaches "perf-per-dollar" wins over Nvidia RTX 3060.

title: Are Android-based game-streaming handhelds a fad, or are they the future?
description: Modern game streaming + retro game emulation + Switch-like design = success?

title: Room-temperature superconducting claim is retracted
description: The problem appears to be some data that's not being shared.

title: FCC OKs satellite de-orbit rule despite possible conflict with NASA guidelines
description: 5-year satellite de-orbit rule passes despite lawmakers questioning FCC authority.

title: Amazon launches its own QLED 4K TVs, starting at $800
description: Amazon's second round of TVs make more (but not many) image-quality claims.

title: A glaring error in methane flaring
description: Three million cars’ worth of emissions could be cut by addressing inefficiency.

title: Microsoft’s web-flavored update for Outlook begins rolling out to more testers
description: Refreshed client is still missing support for IMAP, multiple accounts.

title: Google Stadia officially shuts down January 2023, will refund game purchases
description: The inevitable death of Google's game-streaming service happens early next year.

title: NESOS gives 8-bit system a GUI desktop, 8 tiny files, and it’s amazing
description: You can type out a single screen of text, with a controller. That's impressive.

title: Meta announces Make-A-Video, which generates video from text
description: Using a text description or an existing image, Make-A-Video can render video on demand.

title: Microsoft will end support for its SwiftKey iOS keyboard on October 5
description: SwiftKey for Android will live on, and the tech is still used in Windows.

title: Juno just raced by Europa, providing our best look in 20 years at the icy world
Solar + batteries at home can provide backup power during disasters
description: Hurricanes, other disasters can knock out your power—solar can help, study shows.

title: How hobbyist hackers are preserving Pokémon’s past—and shaping its future
description: Enthusiasts are intent on improving old games, whether Nintendo likes it or not.
